meanings.sent1: Her corruptibility made her an easy target for dishonest schemes.
meanings.sent2: The corruptibility of the system allowed for unethical practices to thrive.
meanings.sent3: The corruptibility of the young prince's character led to some comical misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of deceit, his corruptibility shone like a beacon of vulnerability.
meanings.sent5: The corruptibility of the old building's foundation was evident in its crumbling walls.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being corruptible.
meanings.sent1: The corruptibility of the material was evident in its tendency to decay quickly.
meanings.sent2: She was wary of the corruptibility of power and its potential to lead to abuse.
meanings.sent3: The corruptibility of the software made it prone to glitches and errors.
meanings.sent4: His charm masked the corruptibility of his intentions, deceiving many around him.
meanings.sent5: The corruptibility of the politician's promises became apparent as scandals unfolded.
